document.name: S.H.E
document.text:
From late 2001 to early 2002, Hebe and Ella acted in the drama, ''Magical Love''. Ella starred as Juliet, a recent high school graduate who is constantly looking for her Romeo. Hebe portrayed the secondary role of Sha Sha, Juliet's self-conscious and assertive friend. Selina was absent because she was studying at the National Taiwan Normal University. . May 18, 2005. Retrieved February 24, 2007. The songs "Remember" and "Belief" were used as the drama's opening and ending themes, respectively. In February, S.H.E signed on to be co-hosts on Jacky Wu's show, ''Guess Guess Guess''. During S.H.E's tenure on the show, ratings averaged over 3.5, regularly putting the show in the top 10 for weekend shows. Zhang Ruichen. Liberty Times. July 6, 2002. Retrieved February 27, 2007. S.H.E stopped hosting ''Guess Guess Guess'' in July. In April 2003, the trio guest-hosted two episodes of the Taiwanese variety show, ''Happy Sunday'', before signing on as co-hosts in May. . April 16, 2003. Retrieved March 1, 2007. However, during S.H.E's ''Happy Sunday'' tenure, at the height of the SARS epidemic, Hebe exhibited fever-like symptoms while coming home from Singapore. Channel News Asia. . April 25, 2003. Retrieved February 6, 2007. Since Ella was living with Hebe at the time, both were forced into quarantine for 10 days, leaving Selina as the only one in the group who could host the television show ''Happy Sunday''. News Sichuan (hosted by Tom.com). . May 12, 2003. Retrieved February 6, 2007.
All three S.H.E members appeared in the drama, ''The Rose'', where Ella starred as Bai He, a girl suffering from low self-esteem. Selina played two secondary roles: her first character, Qin, was a beautiful yet frail girl with a heartwarming personality. Her second character, Di Ya Man, is Qin's doppelganger with an arrogant and domineering personality. Hebe portrayed Xiao Feng, a girl who quietly pursues Bai He's love interest, Han Kui. Each episode of ''The Rose'' was originally estimated to cost NT$1 million; Lin Jingping. The Epoch Times. . March 22, 2003. Retrieved February 26, 2007. that number quickly rose to 1.3 million by the time filming had finished. In spite of the high costs, ''The Rose'' was the highest rated television drama in its time slot. . June 30, 2004. Retrieved July 26, 2007. At the 2004 Golden Bell Awards, which are presented by the GIO to honour the year's best television programs, ''The Rose'' was crowned Most Popular Drama. Wu Surou. The Epoch Times. . November 26, 2004. Retrieved February 26, 2007. S.H.E sang "Flowers Have Blossomed" () for the drama's soundtrack. The song not only debuted at #1 on the UFO Music Charts, . Retrieved February 26, 2007. but it also stayed on the YES 93.3 charts for ten weeks, holding the #1 position for two consecutive weeks.
On July 29, 2003, Ella performed a stunt as part of S.H.E's ''Happy Sunday'' segment. The stunt, which involved jumping off different floors of a building, was part of a public service video that explained proper fire escape procedures.Woodworth, Mark. . January 9, 2004. Retrieved February 21, 2007. On her first attempt, Ella followed protocol, jumped off the second floor of a building, and landed safely. . July 30, 2003. Retrieved March 18, 2007. On her second attempt, she was asked to jump off the third floor. However, as she jumped off, Ella became nervous and failed to follow the safety procedures correctly, leading to her falling on a fire escape from twenty feet and shattering her hip. Xinhua Net News. . July 30, 2003. Retrieved February 6, 2007. Paramedics transported her to the Neihu Tri-Service General Hospital before being redirected to the National Taiwan University Hospital. Ella was released from the hospital after a 23 day stay, . August 22, 2003. Retrieved March 19, 2007. but she went home to Pingtung for five months in order to recuperate. In spite of this incident, the Japan National Tourist Organization, who had admired S.H.E's hosting abilities, asked ''Happy Sunday'' to promote Japanese tourism. . November 8, 2003. Retrieved July 26, 2007. As a result, Selina and Hebe hosted "Yokoso! Japan", a special ''Happy Sunday'' segment that explored numerous facets of Japanese culture. Sina.com Entertainment. November 14, 2003. Retrieved February 15, 2007. In January 2004, Ella returned to hosting after her recuperation period, The Epoch Times. . January 4, 2004. Retrieved July 30, 2007. and appeared in the final two episodes of "Yokoso! Japan". However, during the segment's four-episode run, producers were already searching for S.H.E's replacements, and ultimately chose Taiwanese singer Phil Chang. . February 6, 2004. Retrieved July 30, 2007. S.H.E discontinued hosting ''Happy Sunday'' once they began promoting the album ''Magical Journey''. Taipei Today. . February 5, 2004. Retrieved July 30, 2007.
Selina and Hebe, along with 28 other celebrities, were cast for the three-episode drama series ''Happy New Year 2004''. . January 19, 2004. Retrieved April 1, 2007. In February, both S.H.E members co-starred in the movie, ''A Disguised Superstar'' (), with Miriam Yeung; in April, Hebe acted as the female love interest in the first episode of ''Say Yes Enterprise'' (). The episode would earn a rating of 1.93, placing third behind ''My Secret Garden II'' () and ''Snow Angel'' (). Feng Yixian, Chen Youying. The Liberty Times. . April 6, 2004. Retrieved March 3, 2007. In October 2005, all three members of S.H.E starred in the drama, ''Reaching for the Stars'', and sang its opening theme, "Star Light". The drama focused on the fate of an electronics company whose chairman had just died. Selina played the role of Zhou Xinlei, the chairman's spoiled but good-natured daughter. Ella starred as Ren Jie, a clever girl who assumed the identity of the company's heiress to save her brother. Hebe portrayed Shen Xiaorou, a strong-willed policewoman who lives with her ailing grandmother. ''Reaching for the Stars'' had the misfortune of airing its pilot episode during the final episode of ''The Prince Who Turns into a Frog''. While the average rating for the pilot episode of ''Reaching for the Stars'' was 1.17, the final episode of ''The Prince Who Turns into a Frog'' set a 2005 record for highest average episode rating (6.93) and highest episode rating (11.35). . October 18, 2005. Retrieved February 23, 2007. In the end, despite heavy investment in the series' production, . March 29, 2005. Retrieved April 4, 2007. ''Reaching for the Stars'' had only achieved mediocre television ratings. Nevertheless, Ella was nominated for Best Actress at the 2006 Golden Bell Awards. Sohu Entertainment. . November 29, 2006. Retrieved September 3, 2007.
In the spring of 2006, Ella pursued her own on-screen interests, and was cast for the lead female role of a Taiwanese idol drama, which was scheduled to air later that year. In January 2007, S.H.E and Wu Bai were invited to voice over several characters for the Taiwanese rendition of Luc Besson's movie, ''Arthur and the Minimoys''. Epoch Times. January 15, 2007. Retrieved February 15, 2007. During the same month, Selina and Hebe signed half-year contracts to be the co-hosts of ''Guess Guess Guess'', Sina.com Entertainment. . January 23, 2007. Retrieved February 6, 2007. the show that they had hosted five years earlier. The drama starring Ella, ''Hanazakarino Kimitachihe'', finally began airing in November, and continued until its finale on March 4, 2007. Ella was featured as Lu Ruixi, an American tomboy who transfers schools so she can see her high jump idol every day. During its 15-episode run, the drama never relinquished its ratings crown. . August 28, 2007. Retrieved September 3, 2007. S.H.E sang the song, "What to Do?" () as the drama's opening theme. In June 2007, SET TV selected Hebe to star in ''Bull Fighting'' as the daughter of the man who owns 13th Street. S.H.E sang "How Have You Been Lately?" () as the drama's ending theme.
